format.python: ( "", " -out " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.name: dna
children.prompt: Use DNA/RNA colormaps and/or consensus groups (-dna)

children.comment: <html:div xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><html:ul><html:li><html:em>Colour all the residues</html:em>, will colour every residue according to the currently selected palette.</html:li><html:li><html:em>Colouring by identity to the first sequence</html:em>, will colour only those residues that are identical to some reference sequence (usually the query or first row).</html:li><html:li><html:em>Colour only when above a given percent similarity</html:em>, will colour only those residues that belong to a specified physicochemical class that is conserved in at least a specified percentage of all rows for a given column. This defaults to 70% and and may be set to another threshold, eg., -coloring consensus -threshold 80 would specify 80%. Note that the physicochemical classes in question can be confined to individual residues.</html:li><html:li><html:em>Colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong</html:em>, is like -coloring consensus, but colours residues by the colour of the class to which they belong.</html:li></html:ul><html:p>By default, the consensus computation counts gap characters, so that sections of the alignment may be uncolored where the presence of gaps prevents the non-gap count from reaching the threshold. Setting -con_gaps off prevents this, allowing sequence-only based consensus thresholding.</html:p></html:div>
children.name: coloring

format.python: ( "" , " -threshold " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.comment: Tip: If you want to see only the conserved residues above the threshold (ie., only one type of conserved residue per column), add the option -ignore class.

format.python: ( "" , " -ignore " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.name: ignore

children.comment: <html:div xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><html:p>Colouring of an alignment by consensus determines which residues to colour and the colours to use based on</html:p><html:ol><html:li>the consensus threshold chosen for the colouring operation,</html:li><html:li>a consideration of the common physicochemical properties of the residues in that column,</html:li><html:li>the chosen colour scheme.</html:li></html:ol></html:div>
children.name: con_coloring

format.python: ( "" , " -con_threshold " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.name: con_threshold
children.prompt: Consensus line thresholds (in range 50..100) (separated by commas) (-con_threshold)

format.python: ( "" , " -con_ignore " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.comment: You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
children.name: range

format.python: ( "" , " -maxident " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.name: maxident
children.prompt: Only report sequences with percent identity <= N (-maxident)

children.name: ref
children.prompt: Use row N or row identifier as percent identity reference (-ref)

children.comment: You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
children.name: keep_only
children.prompt: Keep only the rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-keep)

children.comment: You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
children.name: disc
children.prompt: Discard rows from start to end (separated by comma) (-disc)

children.comment: You must enter a string composed of two numbers separated by comma
children.name: nops
width
children.prompt: Paginate in N columns of alignment (-width)

children.name: gap
children.prompt: Use this character as the gap (-gap)

children.name: register
children.prompt: Output multi-pass alignments with columns in register (-register)

format.python: ( "" , " -pagecolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -textcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -linkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -alinkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -vlinkcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -alncolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]
( "" , " -labcolor " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

children.name: bold
children.prompt: Use bold emphasis for coloured residues (-bold)

format.python: ( "" , " -css on" )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

references.label: Brown, N.P., Leroy C., Sander C. (1998). MView: A Web compatible database search or multiple alignment viewer. Bioinformatics. 14(4):380-381.
